meanings.sent1: After receiving the products, the company decided to reexport them to different markets.
meanings.sent2: The business was reexporting its surplus inventory to maximize profits.
meanings.sent3: The suitcase was so full that it looked like it was reexporting its contents.
meanings.sent4: The idea reexported from one team member to another, spreading quickly.
meanings.sent5: The seeds reexported by the wind landed in fertile soil, ready to grow.

meanings.definition: The act of exporting goods or services to another country after they have been imported.
meanings.sent1: The reexporting of electronics from one country to another was a common practice.
meanings.sent2: Global trade relied on the efficient reexporting of various products.
meanings.sent3: The reexporting of exotic fruits made the international market more colorful.
meanings.sent4: The concept of reexporting ideas across borders led to innovation.
meanings.sent5: The reexporting of knowledge enriched different cultures around the world.
